title: Arkansas bank to broach Tennessee in $150.1M deal
summary: Buying Knoxville-based Mountain Commerce Bank will give Home BancShares seven branches in coveted Tennessee markets and create a $25 billion-asset lender, the banks said.

title: Trust by numbers: The insight-driven guide to loyalty in banking and payments
summary: Insights that help financial providers build trust where it matters most.

title: Investor wants KeyBank CEO fired
summary: HoldCo Asset Management – which demanded that Comerica sell itself, then sued the bank after it did – accused Key’s top executive of waffling on M&A and weakness on capital management.

title: Ex-CEO of failed Oklahoma bank indicted on fraud charges
summary: Danny Seibel issued fake loans to friends and neighbors and “frequently” altered First National Bank of Lindsay records to hide the activity from the OCC and the bank’s board, the DOJ alleged.
fraud_categories_str: Money Laundering, Regulatory Compliance, Other Financial Crime

title: 3 ex-Signature execs start blockchain bank
summary: N3XT, which opened Thursday, marks Signature founder Scott Shay’s fourth foray into launching a bank.

title: Chime won’t rule out bank charter pursuit, COO says
summary: The fintech, which went public in June, periodically evaluates whether obtaining a bank charter makes more sense than relying on bank partners to offer its services to consumers, COO Mark Troughton said.

title: Dive Deposits: In a down year for diversity, Citi’s reputation is at stake
summary: The bank named a relatively sparse class of new managing directors. Its proportion of women is virtually the same as last year’s – even amid a de-emphasis on DEI. But the bank isn’t outpacing its peers, either.

title: Senate Democrats press credit unions on overdraft, NSF fees
summary: Sens. Elizabeth Warren, Cory Booker and Richard Blumenthal seek answers from 21 credit unions on their overdraft programs by Dec. 14.

title: Lubbock bank to buy Houston lender for $106M
summary: Acquiring the holding company for Bank of Houston would give $4.4 billion-asset South Plains Financial an additional $772 million in assets and bolster its footprint in the Houston area.

title: Bank regulators testify on Trump-era ‘tailoring’
summary: The Federal Reserve’s vice chair for supervision vowed, in testimony to House lawmakers Tuesday, not to “reverse-engineer” changes to capital requirements to fit preconceived notions.

title: HSBC names interim chair to role permanently
summary: The move comes a day after CEO Georges Elhedery downplayed the likelihood that 76-year-old KPMG alum Brendan Nelson would serve long-term.

title: Kraken to buy tokenized equities firm Backed
summary: Terms of the deal are undisclosed, but the acquisition is the crypto firm’s fifth of the year.

title: Digital wallet use outpaces regulators
summary: Consumers are increasingly turning to these mobile tools for convenience and new features. But are regulators keeping pace?

title: Binance names co-founder as co-CEO
summary: Yi He co-founded the firm with Changpeng Zhao, her life partner and Binance’s former CEO, in 2017.

title: PNC wants human-level quality in its digital experience
summary: The Pittsburgh-based lender aims to launch its new mobile app in the first half of next year, said Alex Overstrom, the super-regional’s head of retail banking.

title: Biden admin made ‘coordinated attack’ on crypto: House Republicans
summary: Uniswap CEO Hayden Adams, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse and Gemini co-founder Tyler Winklevoss were all, at different points, debanked, a House committee investigation found.

title: Canada’s Laurentian Bank splits off its commercial, retail ops
summary: National Bank of Canada will acquire the Montreal lender’s retail presence and Laurentian’s Québec branches will close. Fairstone Bank will buy Laurentian’s commercial lending for $1.4 billion.

title: Associated Bank to buy Nebraska lender for $604M
summary: The acquisition would give the Green Bay, Wisconsin-based bank entry into Omaha, along with the No. 2 deposit share in that market.

title: Goldman to buy Innovator Capital Management for $2B
summary: The deal positions Goldman Sachs Asset Management as a top ten active ETF provider globally, according to data from Morningstar Direct.

title: Morgan Stanley to pay $117.4M to resolve Dutch tax case
summary: An Amsterdam subsidiary of the bank bought Dutch-listed shares for short periods, illegally offset dividend withholdings and intentionally filed false tax returns, a public prosecutor’s office said.

title: Australian bank nabs Lloyds data chief to lead AI
summary: Ranil Boteju will return to the Commonwealth Bank of Australia as its chief AI officer to advance the financial services firm’s strategy.

title: Fed approves Pinnacle, Synovus merger
summary: The central bank’s sign-off, combined with shareholders’ approval this month, has the Southeastern banks projecting a Jan. 1 close for their merger of equals.

title: FDIC, OCC, Fed solidify eSLR changes
summary: Regulators finalized a rule cutting capital requirements for the nation’s biggest banks – and proposed a separate trim for community lenders.

title: Green Dot inks deals splitting bank, fintech business
summary: The company, which had been exploring “strategic alternatives” since March, will sell its fintech business to a private equity firm and its bank to a $840 million-asset lender.

title: Revolut valued at $75B
summary: The new valuation comes after the U.K. fintech’s fifth share sale, and just 15 months after Revolut was valued at $45 billion.

title: Comerica, Fifth Third sued by activist investor
summary: HoldCo accused Comerica’s CEO of being “focused solely on advancing his own interests” based on the “rushed” way the bank’s proposed deal with Fifth Third came together.

title: Fulton Financial to buy NJ’s Blue Foundry in $243M deal
summary: The deal comes 18 months after Fulton acquired failed Republic First Bank’s assets, which gave the Pennsylvania-based lender several Garden State locations.

title: MoneyLion to pay $1.75M to settle CFPB lawsuit
summary: The bureau in 2022 alleged the fintech illegally charged an interest rate that exceeds the 36% cap on loans to service members.

title: U.S. Bank hires up for greater Southeast growth
summary: The Minneapolis-based super-regional is adding bankers in some areas where it doesn’t have branches and eyeing further growth in SBA lending, an executive said.

title: VALT Bank applies for de novo charter
summary: Former U.S. Bank executive Matt Gediman said the de novo’s model is “designed to support [SMBs] by making banking uncomplicated, accessible, and integrated with digital tools to run their businesses more efficiently.”

title: CFPB can’t ignore judge’s order: workers union
summary: Trump-era officials can’t use the bureau's refusal of funding to force a shutdown, plaintiffs argue. The agency also issued a “humility pledge” for its supervision examiners.

title: Ex-Truist employee sentenced in ‘complex’ check-cashing scheme
summary: Eight Georgia residents were each ordered to pay the bank more than $390,000 in restitution as part of the case.

title: Citi CFO Mark Mason to step down in March
summary: The bank tapped Gonzalo Luchetti, its head of U.S. personal banking, to succeed Mason, who will become an executive vice chair and leave by the end of 2026 to pursue outside leadership opportunities.

title: Wells Fargo taps Saul Van Beurden to scale AI
summary: The bank also expanded consumer-lending CEO Kleber Santos' responsibilities to allow Van Beurden to focus on overseeing the AI transformation of Wells' business segments.

title: CFPB is transferring its cases to DOJ
summary: The bureau’s acting enforcement chief told staff at an all-hands meeting Thursday that all CFPB employees, as he understood it, would be furloughed at the end of the year, according to a report.

title: TD illegally targeted, fired Chinese-heritage employees: lawsuit
summary: Employees allege TD “intentionally targeted and disproportionately impacted the bank’s Chinese and Chinese American employees” in the wake of its AML scandal.

title: Truist taps Microsoft alum as AI chief
summary: Pascal Belaud, who will start at the Charlotte, North Carolina-based bank next week, will shape the vision and execution of Truist’s AI, data and advanced automation strategy, the lender said.

title: Capital One joins FedNow
summary: The bank signed up for the Federal Reserve’s real-time payments system this week, leaving just two of the eight largest U.S. retail banks that have not.

title: Lloyds to buy UK fintech Curve
summary: The deal, rumored to be for £120 million, drew protests from investor IDC Ventures, which said the sale defies shareholder interests. Curve’s CEO once projected a $50 billion valuation by 2029.

title: NY AG’s office scrutinizes SoLo Funds
summary: The fintech was served a subpoena this year by the state attorney general’s office related to usury concerns, the firm’s head of government affairs and strategic partnerships said Nov. 17.

title: Florida credit union to buy Georgia bank
summary: The transaction, set to close in the second or third quarter of 2026, will expand Community First’s asset total to $3.3 billion with a 31-location footprint.

title: White House nominates Vought aide to lead CFPB
summary: A bureau spokesperson, who declined to comment on the fate of the agency, said Stuart Levenbach’s nomination is technical and extends Russ Vought’s tenure as acting director.

title: LevelField gets state approval to buy Chicago bank
summary: The development caps a nearly three-year journey for the digital asset firm. The proposed purchase still requires the Federal Reserve’s sign-off.

title: FDIC countersues Capital One over special assessment
summary: The bank still owes $99.4 million to the Deposit Insurance Fund after the 2023 failures of Signature and Silicon Valley Bank, the regulator said Monday.

title: JPMorgan Chase enhancing due diligence for clients in the Amazon region
summary: The bank will use a geospatial definition of the region preferred by Indigenous leaders and activists, but the change does not bring any inherent restrictions.

title: Investor blasts Comerica over Fifth Third deal
summary: Dismissing proposals from another bidder – reported to be Regions – “suggests a process engineered to favor Fifth Third rather than one designed to maximize shareholder value,” HoldCo Asset Management asserted Monday.

title: Trump official ‘cherry-picked’ mortgage data, Fed governor’s lawyer says
summary: Criminal referrals against embattled Fed Gov. Lisa Cook “fail on even the most cursory look at the facts,” her attorneys wrote to the Justice Department on Monday.

title: El Paso credit union to buy 11-branch bank
summary: GECU said the deal “sets the stage for a strong combined entity that can support even more members and businesses with their financial needs.”

title: Wells Fargo exec: Cyber is ‘an everybody problem’
summary: “Long gone are the days of the prince from a faraway land with a really bad grammatical email,” the bank’s head of cyber human defense said.

title: OCC terminates Blue Ridge Bank consent order
summary: Now that the consent order has been closed, it’ll “be nice to get back to the banking business,” CEO Billy Beale said.

title: Fed’s Kugler violated trading ethics, disclosure shows
summary: A filing details stock transactions during “blackout periods” that surround interest rate-setting meetings. The paperwork may shed light on the central bank governor’s abrupt August departure.

title: BofA, BNY blast ‘threadbare’ allegations in Epstein victim suit
summary: Bank of America said it’s “not reasonably foreseeable” that rent payments made through an account with the bank would “set in motion” harms to the plaintiff. BNY called the allegations "razor-thin."

title: Synapse bankruptcy case tossed
summary: Some users of Synapse’s fintech partners, such as Yotta and Juno, have posted on a subreddit thread that they’re still personally owed thousands of dollars.

title: Michigan State credit union group acquires fintech Tandem
summary: The acquisition of the couples-focused finance app is part of the $8.26 billion-asset credit union’s plan to create “an end-to-end family banking ecosystem.”

title: Banks turn to AI supervisors as agent use surges
summary: Financial institutions are rapidly deploying AI agents in pursuit of billions in economic value, according to Capgemini.

title: Dive Deposits: CFPB cries poor but tweaks fair lending, data collection
summary: A Justice Department office argued the Fed has no money to fund the bureau. But the CFPB’s acting director hasn’t asked the central bank for money anyway.

title: Wells Fargo aims to entice affluent clients to deepen ties
summary: The lender has rolled out enhanced benefits for premier customers. It’s also added talent and sharpened its management focus on the segment, Wells CFO Mike Santomassimo said recently.

title: JPMorgan exec warns of stablecoin saturation
summary: A deluge of digital coins threatens to make the cryptocurrency a loyalty program like airline frequent flier miles, the bank’s global co-head of payments said Wednesday.

title: Putin approves Citi’s Russia sale
summary: The sale to Renaissance Capital is one piece of a 14-piece puzzle. Citi announced plans to offload its Russian consumer arm and 12 others in 2021, and added Mexico to the list in 2022.

title: Truist to require all employees in office 5 days a week
summary: The Charlotte, North Carolina-based super-regional is ending hybrid work arrangements in January, it said Wednesday.

title: Telcoin Digital Asset Bank nabs final charter approval
summary: Last month, Telcoin said it had raised $25 million to capitalize the bank. It first applied for a charter with the Nebraska Department of Banking and Finance in October 2023.

title: Bank of America runs 270 AI models across operations
summary: The technology will fuel growth and help curb costs through several use cases, executives said during last week's investor day.

title: Thrivent Bank aims to pair advice, digital platform in youth push
summary: The only institution to get an ILC charter application approved during the Biden administration seeks to deliver its parent company’s brand of advice earlier in customers’ lifespans, CEO Brian Milton said.

title: SoFi relaunches crypto trading
summary: “Today marks a pivotal moment when banking meets crypto in one app, on a trusted platform, and driven by our core mission to help our members get their money right,” CEO Anthony Noto said.

title: Atlanta Fed president Bostic to retire in February
summary: The first Black and openly gay regional Fed chief is leaving before the central bank’s board votes to reappoint the presidents of the Fed’s outposts to new five-year terms.

title: HSBC waters down interim targets in updated net-zero transition plan
summary: The bank scaled back a range of goals it was pursuing for its sector-specific 2030 targets, citing a global transition that “has progressed at an inconsistent pace.”

title: Coinbase fined $24.8M by Irish central bank
summary: The crypto firm found three coding errors in its transaction monitoring system, but that meant the company insufficiently monitored 30 million transfers for AML, fraud and child sex exploitation, the central bank said.
fraud_categories_str: Cyber Crime, Money Laundering, Regulatory Compliance, Other Financial Crime

title: Gould intent on tackling debanking, tailoring issues
summary: “I hope that when the 33rd comptroller shows up, at some uncertain date in the future, that that person will not blame me for kicking any cans down the road,” Jonathan Gould said in an interview.

title: Dive Deposits: Was Waller’s ‘skinny’ account clarification a walk-back?
summary: The Federal Reserve governor set out to clarify that only institutions with a banking charter would be eligible for a tailored master account. Does that jibe with the central bank’s “embrace” of disruption?

title: M&T eschews the temptation of national presence
summary: The Buffalo, New York-based lender remains focused on dominance in its current markets, said CEO René Jones, expressing some doubt that banks can perform at optimal levels as they expand.

title: PNC boosts new-branch effort to 300 by 2030
summary: The Pittsburgh-based bank aims to hire 2,000 new employees and open 35 new locations in Nashville and 25 in Chicago.

title: Amerant Bank CEO steps down
summary: On an earlier earnings call, now-former CEO Jerry Plush noted nonperforming assets rose to $140 million, from $98 million the previous quarter.

title: Comerica received at least one deal offer before Fifth Third
summary: A filing Wednesday detailed a relatively quick negotiation, along with several short-term perks for Comerica CEO Curt Farmer.

title: BaFin levies largest-ever fine against JPMorgan
summary: JPMorgan SE's €45 million fine surpassed the prior record fine of €40 million, levied against Deutsche Bank.

title: BofA investor day spotlights co-presidents Athanasia, DeMare
summary: In response to an analyst’s skepticism, co-president Jim DeMare said he and Dean Athanasia were put in their positions to help drive “rigor” around bank units meeting growth goals.

title: Ally trims headcount by another 2%
summary: The bank’s second workforce cut of the year comes as executives from three of the nation’s four largest banks offered insights into the future trend of employee numbers – with nods to AI.
